intro: Androsace saussurei, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-eared chrysanthemum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in harsh mountain environments. Androsace saussurei thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
